definition[0]: to shout or say something very loudly, especially because you are frightened, angry, or excited
example[2]: The crowd are on their feet yelling.
example[3]: He could hear Pete yelling at the top of his voice  (=very loudly).
example[4]: Clare yelled in pain as she fell.
example[5]: Don’t you yell at me like that!
example[6]: They yelled at him to stop.
note[2]: yell at somebody to do something
example[7]: If you need me, just yell.
example[8]: She let out a yell when she saw me.
example[9]: Dan gave a yell of delight when Larsson scored.
definition[3]: words or phrases that students and cheerleaders shout together to show support for their school, college etc
